testfieldgame

Class FieldQuadrant

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • testfieldgame.FieldQuadrant
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class FieldQuadrant
extends java.lang.Thread
    FieldQuadrant is a Thread which operates with its own personal 2d part of the data field - fieldQuad. fieldQuad is fullfilled with zeros, except for some position, where it contains "ones". The purpose of FieldQuadrant is to move "ones" to the left in fieldQuad 2d array. When yet another "one" comes to the left boundary - it goes to another FeildQuadrant via its own msgQueue. Also if some other FieldQuadrants put a message in msgQueue of the current FieldQuadrant, then it will put some more "ones" in its field getting these messages for the queue.

    FieldQuadrant has access to other threads of the game via array fieldQuadrantAr. FieldQuadrant makes its game turn in call makeTurn() (). Then it puts messages to msgQueues of other quadrants increasing jobsCount counter. Here, FieldQuadrant decreases jobsCount, because it has done its own main job. Then it takes massages from its own msgQueue in call takeMessagesFromQueue() () and decreases jobsCount.

    When changing jobsCount, we run jobsCount.notify in order to notify main thread about amount of jobs left to perform. When jobsCount is zero, the main thread (in Game class) will interrupt all the FieldQuadrants. Normally, the should just wait at thier empty queue.get() and be ready to be interrupted.

    After a turn, the main thread will renew FieldQuadrant threads in a loop via getNewCloneWithOldLinks() ().

    FieldQuadrant usage example is shown in Game class.

    • Method Detail

      • getDeepCopyFiledQuad

        public int[][] getDeepCopyFiledQuad()
        Access to fieldQuad data is given only via deepCopy. It is used in tests to confirm that expected data equals actual.
        Returns:
        deep copy of fieldQuad 2d array.

      • getNewCloneWithOldLinks

        public FieldQuadrant getNewCloneWithOldLinks()
        Threads are dead after they were interrupted and stoped. To perform new work, we make a new clone with all the same references to old objects. So the thread is renewed, but the data is old. Should be used carefully, so that no data leak occurs.
        Returns:
        new FieldQuadrant with old data inside.

      • getNY

        public int getNY()

      • printString

        public void printString(int j)
        Prints j-s string of fieldQuad data field (System.out stream). Used in printing of all field in Game class. Not Thread Safe.
        Parameters:
        j - - number of string in fieldQuad array to be printed.

      • setRandomInit

        public void setRandomInit(int amountNonzero)
        For proper independent tests we need to set initial data in a randomized way.
        Parameters:
        amountNonzero - is amount of non zero (i.e. ones) elements in fieldQuad.

      • run

        public void run()
        Concurrent run function actually calles makeTurn().
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • makeTurn

        public void makeTurn()
        Main function of the class. Do my own job moving "ones" to the left. Then ask other threads to move "ones", which have gone out of current fieldQuad. Take the same messages coming to current threads from the others in takeMessagesFromQueue().

      • setAfterMyTurnIndex

        public void setAfterMyTurnIndex(int i,
                                int j,
                                int val)
        puts new message in msgQueue. Should not be interrupted. If it was interrupted, it means some error occured.
        Parameters:
        i - - position to put val in fieldQuad 2d array.
        j - - position to put val in fieldQuad 2d array.
        val - - normally equals to "one" in versions 1.0, 2.0
